thread.title: Something Wicked And unite4:good Partner To Activate #ProjectDisco In Houston

author: cbs8
title: Something Wicked And unite4:good Partner To Activate #ProjectDisco In Houston
text:
Information contained on this page is provided by an independent third-party content provider. WorldNow and this Station make no warranties or representations in connection therewith. If you have any questions or comments about this page please contact pressreleases@worldnow.com .
SOURCE #ProjectDisco
LOS ANGELES , Oct. 22, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Disco Donnie Presents, an award-winning SFX Entertainment company that organizes and promotes hundreds of EMC-focused festivals and events at North American venues each year, and unite4:good ( www.u4g.com ) , a global movement for kindness and social good, today announce the activation of #ProjectDisco at the #SomethingWicked Music Festival ( www.SomethingWicked.com ) taking place in Houston, TX on October 24 th and 25 th , 2015. The 4 th annual Something Wicked event is presented by Disco Donnie Presents and NightCulture at Sam Houston Race Park. #ProjectDisco is an initiative that unites music and social good at Disco Donnie Presents events and venues across the U.S. with the goal to inspire event attendees to make a difference in their communities by committing to acts of kindness and service. The result will be positivity at the festival, while providing opportunities for attendees to make a difference and a measurable impact on the local community.
The #ProjectDisco initiatives taking place on-site at Something Wicked that aim to help foster kindness and social good and include:
#iam4: Photo Campaign - This initiative demonstrates the Something Wicked and unite4:good mission to use the power of social media to help bring awareness to causes and charitable organizations in an effort to make a positive difference and promote social good. To spread the message of positive action, participants write the name of the cause or charitable organization that most resonates on the blank line provided on an #iam4 template sign and take a photo holding the sign. Participants can then post the photo on their social media platforms with hashtags #iam4 and #u4g to show support for their cause and to demonstrate good will. Each social media post results in a donation from unite4:good to a local non-profit. #kindsquad – The #kindsquad team will be roaming the festival looking for acts of kindness among the crowd. Those who commit random kind acts will be rewarded with event upgrades as well as #ProjectDisco merchandise. #ProjectDisco Something Wicked Artist Lounge - Artists and talent will head backstage to the artists lounge where they can participate in the #iam4 : Photo Campaign. #kindcamp - The kindcamp is #ProjectDisco's headquarters and will house the #iam4 Photo Campaign. In addition to the #iam4 Campaign, greeting cards will be available here and participant can sign and decorate cards with a kind note that will be delivered post-event to a local children's hospital. The initiatives above will encourage fans and event-goers to participate in taking a stand for positive action, social causes and inspire them to explore issues that personally resonate. Rewards for participating in the above initiatives include emazing lights' kandi bracelets, a chance to win a trip to Disco Donnie Presents' The Day After Festival taking place in Panama City, Panama in January 2016 , as well as VIP upgrades at the festival.
To chronicle the acts of kindness and social good at Something Wicked, THE BALCONY'S Kenny Holland, as well social media superstars Rickey Thompson and Anthony Quintal will be on hand to post up-to-date happenings at the event on their social media platforms. These influencers have demonstrated their social media power, as evidenced by the heavily engaged fans and followers they have amassed, and by their use of social media platforms to promote positive social change.
"We are thrilled to activate an initiative that will foster acts of kindness and produce a sense of community at this year's Something Wicked event," said Anthony Melikhov , founder of unite4:good . "The fans at Something Wicked already share a similar passion for music and art, so we are excited to deliver a program that allows them to further share a passion to create social good."
#ProjectDisco will soon announce additional activations that are scheduled to take place across events and venues in the U.S. for the remainder of 2015. With over 600 shows a year that attract nearly a million people annually, Donnie Disco Presents engages with millennials who, as a generation, have demonstrated a strong commitment to the values celebrated by unite4:good .
For more information on the Donnie Disco Presents roster of upcoming events, please visit: www.discodonniepresents.com .
For more information on unite4:good , please visit: www.u4g.com .
For more information on the Something Wicked Festival, please visit: www.somethingwicked.com .
For more information on the NightCulture, please visit: www.nightculture.com .
ABOUT Disco Donnie Presents
The Disco Donnie Presents, an SFX Entertainment Company, is an award-winning and recognized leader in electronic dance music event production, founded by veteran promoter James "Disco" Donnie Estopinal . Since the company's inception in 1994, DDP has generated over 5,000 live events, arena shows and outdoor festivals in over 100 markets around the world, including the US, Mexico , Canada and Latin America. DDP, both on its own and through partnership, develops innovative and strategic business opportunities in live entertainment. Disco Donnie Presents was acquired by SFX Entertainment, Inc. in 2012. Additional information is available at www.discodonniepresents.com .
ABOUT NightCulture
NightCulture Inc. "Concerts that Change Your Life," is a premier producer of live concerts and events. NightCulture operates in the following markets: Houston, TX , Austin, TX , Dallas, TX , San Antonio, TX. NightCulture was the first Electronic Music oriented company to trade in the public markets. NightCulture Inc. produces two major music festivals. Something Wicked Halloween Music Festival, which drew over 40,000 fans 2014 in Houston, TX. & Something Wonderful in Dallas, TX making its debut in 2015. Stereo Live, LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of NightCulture, operates Stereo Live, a 25,000 square foot music and live events venue located on 2 1/2 acres of land at 6400 Richmond Avenue in Houston, Texas .
ABOUT unite4:good
The U4G platform ( u4g.com ), launching in Fall 2015, bridges the digital world with real-world action by uniting individuals, brands, non-profit organizations, thought leaders and influencers in a common goal of creating kindness and social good. The platform inspires users to earn points through their kindness and philanthropic efforts; and offers the opportunity to redeem or donate those points in the online marketplace for tangible rewards. The U4G platform is a new 'ecosystem' that makes doing good the most direct path to individual fulfillment, cause awareness and a sustainable, measurable global shift towards positivity.
